name: Peddling Tricks
description: Atman+Datasucker and Parasite Recursion with Kit. Very aggressive and very utility based. A lot of different tricks depending on the board. SMC can bring out a nice range of useful programs. Surprise Archer or Oversight AI'd Janus? Sharpshooter or Deus Ex take them down pretty quickly. Cheap ICE making you waste Kits ability? Parasite removes them in a jiffy! This is a fun deck, but I'm sure could use some work. I didn't realize it was over by a card, so that will need to be fixed.

name: Run run run run run
description: Use Datasucker + 0 strength atman in combination with Sonic's extra runs to grab a bunch of virus tokens. I think.

name: Iain Bigrig
I need 6, you need 7.
Silhouette Noteriety
Clickfcuk
description: You want clicks. This deck has clicks. I've gotten up to six clicks each turn and it's great. Biotic Labors have all been cast aside, since I never actually used them when they were in here.

name: 6 Agenda Medtech
Caissa Workshop
description: Personal Workshop + Deep Red = All the mid-run Caissa installations. I always found that to be the most fun part of my old Shaper Caissa deck, so I've focused on it. I wish I had a more reliable way to get PW up and running, because it's a lot of influence. Clone Chips would probably be a boon.

name: Fur Coat 2.0
description: Building off previous Exile Builds, this is a culmination of a lot of ideas in one deck. I think it has a lot of potential.

name: TI slow advance v. 1.3
description:
Chaining astroscripts is so last year. In Tennin Institute we we chain Future Perfect into Nisei into Unorthodox Predictions like there's no tommorow.

Mushin No Shin the grndl for 24 credits to rez all your big ice. It's also good with any agenda and junebug. Caprice is obvious, but even better with Nisei and some nasty ice. Midori to counter knights and parasites (think Inazuma), can trap sometimes. Subliminal is good with everything.

Not sure about the ice, Heimdal is pretty expensive and can be clicked through. Can i get 3rd Inazuma to work efficiently? Need more testing.

name: NBN Making News
Kill ya dead
HM: Fast Advance - Help needed
description:
This is my first attempt to build a HM-Fast Advance Deck. The main reason why i built this deck is, because i really really like the idea behind Medtech, but all my rush-deck attempts (junebugs, ToL, Mushin, Archer) failed horribly. It seems to be so hard to keep out the runner, especially when they play classic andy with anarch suite.

I only played one match with this deck via OCTGN so far and could pull of a win, but i am still unsure about how consistent a deck like this could be.

So any advices how to build and play a proper JHM-Deck are highly appreciated :)

EDIT: I might get rid of the fundraisers and use celebrity gifts instead, because i don't want to give the runner the money to trash my assets and upgrades...

name: Slow Leaks - Patient DLR v1.1
description:
The exact opposite of the usual DLR Anarch deck. Spend the early game grabbing a few agendas to pawn, and building up your board. Once you feel you can support it, start taking tags and milling, while they're struggling to score through Chakana.

-NACH + Stirling + Joshua B. will give you 5 clicks a turn instead of your 2 credits, if you feel you need it. (Not sure if that combo needs to be there, I just want to try it.)

-Unregistered actually helps with DLR's main weakness: Jackson Howard. If you can't wait to mill them, it should enable glory runs.

name: wyld theory
Exposed in 3 Seconds
description: New Version of my first Silhoutte Build

name: Ristie Newbie v0.07
description:
Trying to keep a theme, the idea is to: Tinkering -> Faerie/e3 -> Crescentus to break up the ice, and Forged Activation Orders -> Compromised Employee(s) to profit from the ice getting put up.

Test Run was there partially to allow Femme Fatale to be deployed quickly as a one off to be reinstalled later, but I've been informed that Femme Fatale bypasses not breaks, so that wouldn't work. :-(

Any thoughts/advice folks?

name: New Runner Deck
description: New deck for Noise with the few data packs I have now. No idea if it'll work. Not a whole heap of icebreakers, but lots of money

name: Personal Devolution
description: My attempt at a jinteki flatline deck. Looking for feedback. Brain damage and hand size reduction for scorched earth or EMP kill.

name: Seppuku
Nauty Secrets 1.0
description: The Idea of this deck is to stop the hacker getting through and load up free advancements on Ice Wall / Shadow for Trick of light fast advance. Currently am looking at the agendas been hard to get hold of, but i also think lowering them for faster advancement could be a better way to go. Comments welcome

name: Shi Kyu Harmony v1.0
description: Built to take advantage of a couple of synergies. Mental Health Clinic + sweeps week. And harmony medtechs ability to field jsut 6 3 pointers in a 44 card deck along with a full 3 copies of shi-kyu.

name: Unleashed
Kit's Paintbrush v1.3
description: Now, Let's go paint some happy trees...

name: Paintbruch Girl
Fast and Furious - Tested Godness
description: This woman can rush very hard, her ID abillity helps a lot to go erly siphons or Legwork. Logos is very good. It gives you what do you want in hard situation to keep up your hard work. Magnum Opus is very helpfull in erly but you can replace it for Event/Resource econ later. Maybe I will include one Akamatsu Mem Chip (Logos Helps). She is hard to stop and very fast. I think it will be as good as old Gabe or Andromeda.

name: CT WARGAMES
BBRRAAIINNSS!
description: The Idea is simple Cause brain damage till the runner is either flat-lined or too afraid to run. I have no idea if this deck will be competitive and is made as a fun deck idea rather than a actual competitive deck.

name: Can't Touch This
description:
Variation of my diversified assets. The concept is to lay out a ton of remote servers and to keep the runner guessing as to which are agendas and which are traps. I would like to add some more ambushes, but not sure what/where to get there.

Caprice Nisei guards your archives. Use your ICE to guard HQ and R&D. Bullfrog and Susanoo protect any servers you want to score an agenda through.

Operation based econ are all low cost, so they can be played at will. Plenty of drip econ coming through sundews and pad campaigns. Encryption protocols make sure that money keeps flowing.

name: Notorious Daily Quester
description: This deck utilizes the new central only breakers in combination with Quest Completed to maintain utter board control. Silhouette is uniquely positioned, thanks to her ability, in always knowing which cards to access or not access with a Quest Completed. Having no multi-access for R&D available, this deck aims to make the most of the new Legwork card to target fast advance and Cerebral Imaging's most vulnerable point, their agenda cluttered hand. Magnum Opus provides more money than we can dream of, plenty to play big draws like Quality Time and to leverage our Doppelganger's ability to let us pressure harder than other Runners. Feint and Emergency Shutdown will also allow us to put more economic pressure on the corp as well. Finally, Notoriety can grant a surprise win from as few as 4 to 7 with use of Early Bird + Doppelganger. I decided to include the new S&W '35 hardware both as Power Shutdown defense and as a way to remove pesky Jackson Howards from the Corps remotes. The other option was Silencer which would give us more of an economic advantage by making our first sentry use each turn cheaper, but I decided to give the new toy a try first.

name: Notorious Daily Quester
description:
Second verse same as the first, now put me on a plane so I can put 'em in a hurse. (Check the previous version for full rundown)

Added Security Testing to make Jinteki Archive runs less painful and a way to make a little extra cash with an open archives if R&D isn't worth the run.

name: Orphan White
description:
I've mixed together pieces of some other Tenma decks with a few modifications. It has performed very well in the two games I've played with it. I came back from being behind 6-0 against a Jinteki deck when I couldn't find a barrier breaker or special order even without any hard Jinteki counters.

Economy

I went with VoicePad due to the event heavy nature of this deck and Lucky Find seemed like a natural addition. Siphon, dirty laundry, sure gamble, lucky find, voicepad, and the credits from the ID seem like enough econ to keep me going, but this definitely needs more testing. It might actually be more economy than needed.

Events

In addition to the burst economy events, I wanted to include notoriety and quest complete. I'm not sure if quest complete is needed, but it has been incredibly easy to hit all 3 servers with the combo of central breakers, doppelganger, and early bird. I'm also considering removing planned assault even though it seems useful to be able to tutor up siphon, legwork, or inside job. I would like to include other powerful events like emergency shutdown or indexing, but I'm not sure what to cut to fit them.

Breakers

I liked the idea of going breaker light and using clone chips to get back trashed breakers. Clone chips seem even more valuable against the soon to be Jinteki heavy meta. I replaced the inefficient breach with a corroder and kept the other two central breakers. I have considered including one or two backups like faerie or crypsis, but I don't know what to cut. I also have a variant of this deck with datasuckers and anarch breakers and no quest complete. I need to test that as well to see which is more efficient.

I'm really enjoying the aggression and combo potential of this deck so far. It takes what I enjoyed about Andromeda and intensifies my desire to run early and often. There are so many other events I would like to be able to include, but deck space gets so tight. Specifically I want some Jinteki counters like Deus X. Any advice on changes is appreciated. This looks to be an incredibly fun and possibly powerful new archetype.

name: Catch You With Your Pants Down 1.0
description:
Still a work in progress.

Force the crop to rez stuff when and where they do not want to so that I can get accesses where I want to be.

Shut down their ice to rerez it.

SOT and Levy AR Lab Access to reoccur economy and shutdowns/SOT

name: Development Hell 6.1
description:
Updated version of my "dev hell" deck.

pseudo glacier "slow advance" -

Use hedge + pad + adonis to make cash (or tax runner when they trash).

Use biotic + trick of light to score agendas out of hand. Jackson + archived memories + overadvanced vitruvius can get them back as necessary.

Jackson can do so much here - accelerate your deck, protect agendas in archives, retrieve money assets + fast advance options, or function as accelerated beta test insurance. The usual.

Aggressive secretary functions as your TOL bank, but if you can bait someone into it, it will help things tremendously.

Ice is personal preference and a lot of 1x to vary it up. There might be better options here so experiment.

name: Punitive Future
description: when you have one or two punitive in hand install, advance advance everything.If they run they will die in a way or another. if they don't run you'll score 2 5for3 agendas for the win

name: the silhouette connection
description:
crazy idea of deck

run only on central, look remotes with silhouette ability if its an agenda do a quest completed, if nothing else, do notoriety

get money from calling in favors

name: Paintbrush Girl
NBN Making News
Classic Theory
Glitch - Noise Parasite Recursion
description: Run a lot, facecheck everything, kill ice with parasites, wyrm, and datasuckers. Mulligan for Professional Contacts, unless you get Djinn + great burst econ.

name: NEXT Design Never Advance
description: Hybrid of NBN Never Advance and the Redcoats deck.

name: Beowulf v1.0
description:
This is my first attempt to make a Norse-Germanic themed deck, and the first time I've been frustrated by the 10 influence on Grendel.

The current play style here is build it high and burn the bad pub. I very nearly went sideways into a tag & bag game and probably still could.

My personal view is that this deck contains too many agendas.

name: Iain Bigrig v.1
Jinteki 3.0 Bigrig Style
Jintekitry v2.2
description: needed more tax! -1 Eve -1Popup +2 Toolbooth also Honor and Profit shenanigans!

name: Iain Sterling - Criminal Network v1.2
description:
The impetus of this deck was the desire to find a play style that was different from the usual Criminal style--hard-charging from the get-go, but losing steam in the late-game. Iain's style seems to be slow-but-steady-wins-the-race.

The events in this deck are also different from the usual Criminal tools. The cards included here are strictly for tutoring the cards you need and to pay for the installs. The Helpful AI, Rabbit Holes and Borrowed Satellites ensure that Underworld Contacts (a.k.a "dirty money") are providing credits early while also enabling a larger hand size and heavy link defense. Calling In Favors is primarily intended for the mid-to-late game to provide powerful burst economy for runs when you have your network up and running.

Summary Gameplay: Get your network in-place as quickly as possible. Use Hostage to get Professional Contacts, Kati Jones, and The Helpful AI (a.k.a, the "Triumverate") into play early, or use them for Underworld Contacts if you draw into the Triumverate. Is the Corp fast-advancing agendas? Take advantage and use Iain's ability to grab those breakers faster. Use the dedicated breakers to put pressure on the centrals. Use Cripsis and Ninja to get into remotes when necessary. Ninja is there for Swordsman.

Remember: this is the Criminal that shines in the mid-to-late game, like a Shaper. Take it slow, but steady -- like drinking a glass of scotch. Savor the experience.

name: The Thing That Should Not Be
description:
This is my Harmony Medtech build, and it is a beast. It's current record is 12-1 (the only loss came from a friend playing it for the first time against me) and shows no sign of slowing down.

The main advantage of this ID is that it provides no opportunity for the runner to slow down and regain control. The runner has to constantly maintain pressure lest he be outscored in 3-4 turns. This leads to runners making mistakes they wouldn't normally make. I usually win by scoring 6 points (it's alarmingly easy), but I have often won by kill too. Interestingly, if you notice, going for the kill is not the aim of this deck. Instead, damage is simply used to slow the runner down. But, funny things can happen like killing the runner with Yagura :P

Agendas:

Braintrust - Simply a 3/2 agenda that gets points. Sucks a little when these get stolen

Medical Breakthrough - This card is GOOD, like Astro good. Honestly, you kind of want the first one to get stolen. That brings down the next one to a 3/2, and then you can fast track the other one for an easy 2/2. One game, threw 2 of these and MHC down in open remotes. Runner hit 1 of them (just like I hoped), then on my turn, got a buck from MHC and scored the other. Next turn, scored the other from hand and we were at match point. That just feels good :)

NAPD Contract - Everybody knows this agenda is awesome and in here is works great. Because of how much pressure the runner is under, they often have just enough money to get into a server. I have seen many NAPD’s just stared at and put back down.

Philotic Entanglement - God, kills me that this is only a 1 per deck! Again, another 3/2 and it slows the runner down if they scored anything. While I prefer to score this if they have already stolen 1-2 agendas, but I’ll score it right away if need. You are preferably scoring an agenda at least every 1-2 turns, 3 at the most.

Assets:

Jackson Howard - What can be said? He does whatever you need. Draw, archive saves, etc. He also works great as a bluff. I rarely end up keeping him on the board long, so I’ll stick him in a protected server and let the runner run it thinking he’s an agenda. This tactic works great in this deck. Everything starts to look like an agenda.

Mental Health Clinic - This is a fun card. Again, I’m not trying to flatline the runner, so the 1 plus card doesn’t bother me. Instead the runner is faced with a problem: let me have 1 credit or spend 3 and not get an extra card…. hmmm :) I’ll also use this as a bluff

Snare! - Again, slow them down and make them fear you. It can kill, but usually not unless is gets pulled towards the end of the game when they get desperate and reckless. I sometimes use this as an agenda bluff, but only if the runner has proven that they will run everything that I lay down. Otherwise, keep it in hand for when Celebrity shows up.

Upgrades:

Caprice Nisei - She is boss. Shoot, often I’ll throw her down,immediately rezz and the runner ignores that server the rest of the game. Perfect….

SanSan City Grid - Strictly speaking, you don’t NEED this to win, but it sure helps. At the very least, you soak up 5 credits on the trash. Then you just Jackson it back in...

Operations:

Celebrity Gift - Not much to say. Makes money when you don’t have a lot.

Fast Track - This is pretty recent addition. I found that I was often digging for the last agenda I needed. Now I can just tutor it up into a hand of Snares and operations

Hedge Fund - Yup

Medical Research Fundraiser - So, most people have been going back and forth on this card. I like it a lot, but only in the right situation. You have to be careful when you play. If the runner ended their turn with 0-3 credits, then DO NOT play this card. The better time to play this is when the runner is already flush with credits and getting 3 more won’t make much difference. Typically anything over 10 and I’ll play it if I need it. Again, another thing a lot of corps seem to forget is that you shouldn't be blowing through all your money cards as soon as they hit your hand. Hang onto them until you need them. They pad out your HQ and can surprise the runner.

ICE:

Wall of Static - Go get your Corroder buddy….

Quandary - Go get your Yog

Yagura - A great little piece of ice, best on R&D of course

Grim - Use this to trash whatever will slow down the runner the most.

Guard - Perfect for remote servers and sneaking out an agenda. Also forces a sentry break to come out

Komainu - I didn't know what to think of this before, but I freaking love this ice! Sure, it dies to Parasite but no ice is perfect. No matter what, this ice puts a hardship on the runner. Pay 5 credits to get through with a full hand, or drop dangerously low to make it cheap. Interestingly, half the card is taxing, the other half sets up a kill. Very cool

Pup - Taxing. Love it. Put it on R&D

Swordsman - This is my little surprise ice. If nobody is playing Atman or Knight or Crypsis or Overmind, then you don’t need it. But I’m going to hazard a guess and say that those are showing up a lot these days. :)

Tsurugi - Taxing. Also, slim chance, but can setup a kill too. Great ice

Anyway, still playing around with the exact composition of everything (thinking about how Mushin can fit into the deck and possibly Shi.Kyū) but I’m pretty stinking happy with how it is performing currently. Give it a spin and let me know how it goes!

name: The Notorious Express
description:
So I know I'm not the only one who got the idea of combining central-only breakers with Notoriety. But I'm just so happy to have a great excuse to use this super-cool card. :)

This deck isn't obsessed too much with run events, but is obsessed with constantly being aggressive, and running on a shoestring budget. Usually this works out, scoring at least one notoriety and an agenda or two early game, making mid/late-game cleanup easier. Usually all this deck really needs for economy are a few account siphons and dirty laundry.

I'm also really happy with my breakers. Passport is a great decoder early on, and can be replaced by Peacock to deal with Tollbooth (1 credit cheaper). Breach is better than Corroder for barriers that are Eli and stronger, and has proven to be my most valuable breaker (unless I'm playing against Weyland, in which case I find my killer ASAP once they score a Takeover)

My MVPs (besides the obvious Siphon) would be Same Old Thing, Security Testing, and Inside Job without question. This deck lives to bypass ice, which means Guard is a big inconvenience without Femme.

The deck originally swapped an Indexing for Keyhole, but in addition to the $1 you get from Indexing, I decided that Indexing dealt with Jinteki net damage and synergized with Doppelgänger just as well, plus I won't run into as many MU problems.

name: TWIY* - Primetime Blitz - H&P Edition
description:
trying to change it up a bit and keep it at 40 cards. feedback is always appreciated.

-2 SanSan +2 Red Herrings -2 Jackson Howard +3 Fast Track

switched up the ICE and added +2 Guard

name: Night of Long Knives
description:
A typical Jinteki obfuscation deck,

Play all ice on R&D and HQ, it's really just there to annoy the runner. Play out all the Agenda's and Assets nice and flat with 2 adv counters on each.

Use Howard to recur some traps and save agenda's thrown in the trash if you get a bad draw.

I've not played this deck yet, so your mileage may vary.

Comments and Suggestions appreciated.

name: Neural Imaging v1
PSI madness
description:
Primary goal is to win on points behind Ash and Caprice with flatline being a secondary win condition.

This deck wants to build a single remote with nasty upgrades and start scoring. When Scorch would kill the runner - throw a Cerebral Cast, even without Scrorched on hand - it will practically force brain damage on the runner (which might come handy later).

Also with this agenda setup it is rather safe to Celeb Gift your entire hand most of the time. Snowflake is great, people actually usually break it which is an amazing deal - you get a 3str barrier for a single credit!

name: Mushin No Shin-anigans
description:
This is a Jinteki rush deck, which uses ambushes and Trick of Light to Fast Advance off of failed ambushes. The key card for setting up those ambushes/Trick of Light-batteries is Mushin no Shin.

Agendas

This is a standard Jinteki-Fast Advance assortment of agendas. All agendas are worth 2 points, so it always takes 3 agendas to win. 6 out of 9 agendas cost 3 or less (Braintrusts, 2nd and 3rd Medical Breakthroughs, and Philotic Entanglement). These can all be scored off of 1) a Mushin no Shin, 2) a Mushin'ed Plan B, or 3) a Trick of Light, making use of a failed ambush. Meanwhile, the 4-difficulty agendas are not meant for scoring, except in need. The NAPD contracts are taxing to steal, and the 1st Medical Breakthrough is useful regardless of whether it is scored or stolen.

Assets

There are six ambushes that are meant for Mushin no Shin. 3-advanced Junebugs are great for a flatline. 3-advanced AggSecretaries will curb-stomp a rig, and they are also useful at 1- or 2-advancements, if Mushin is not available. 3-advanced Plan Bs will score 6 out of 9 agendas. If the runner does not go for these traps, they become Trick of Light batteries. On the other hand, the GRDNL Refinery can be used as a great infusion of money, whether Mushin'ed (20 creds) or Install-Advance-Advanced (16 creds). Also, if the runner thinks that you have multiple GRDNL Refineries, then he is more likely to run on your remotes--to his doom. Meanwhile, Jackson Howard smooths out the flow of agendas. Shi.Kyu defends Archives, and potentially forces the runner to need 4 agendas to win.

Operations

Mushin no Shin and Trick of Light are the all-stars in this deck. The rest of the operations are a variety of economy cards. This deck does not need a ton of economy, since Mushin and Trick are cheap, and the ICE is pretty affordable. Also, Mushin no Shin is a sort of economy and a very effective one at that.

ICE

This is a rush deck, so the ICE layout includes lots of cheap End the Run (Himitsu-Bako, Wall of Static, Quandary, Guard, Chimera). Guard is included in greater quantity because it is great for single-handedly protecting a Mushin'ed agenda in an early-game rush. Yagura is a decent early-game helper on R&D. Hive and Komainu are the big stoppers. Hive should be useful all the way into the end game, since it will still have a subroutine even at match-point. Komainu is effectively an ETR, since only a fool would access an unknown Jinteki card after losing his hand.

Room for Tweaking

I'm still trying to decide what economy operations will be most helpful. Celebrity Gift is good money and can set up "mind games," but it gives away information. Subliminal Messaging can goad the runner into trouble or benefit from turns that the runner is recovering from something like a Komainu or Shi.Kyu. Medical Research Fundraiser is nice, since the ICE is all binary. If they don't have the right breakers, it doesn't matter how much cash they have. I went with Celebrity Gifts, but I could change my mind.

For the ICE, I am still finding the right formula. I am tempted to add Grims to "turn back on" my binary ICE. However, the Bad Publicity would hurt my NAPD Contracts. Right now, the AggSecretaries are doing a good job of program trashing, so that may be enough.

If I could find the room, I would love to add some Snares to guard R&D/HQ, but what would I take out?

name: Psychic Blast
description:
This is my first attempt at a Nisei Division deck. The main idea of this deck is that it uses PSI ICE as either Pop-ups when it wants money, or ups the PSI when it wants to block access. Sometimes you even do that randomly when you've trained your opponent to expect 0s, to make them waste clicks.

The deck doesn't run a lot of econ but it also runs very cheap since most of my ICE either give me money, and/or are very cheap to rez.

The deck strategy is Never Advance, with a side-order to Tag & Bag. I make one big remote and then start cycling my agendas and ambushes through it and hope I get them to hit the latter and let me score the former. Given lack of exposes in decks lately, it seems to work decently.

Cerebral Cast is a star in Nisei Division. It costs me almost nothing to play, and if I'm holding a scorched in my hand, the opponent will usually go for 1 brain damage rather than lose 4 cards or risk a flatline, making further cerebral casts even scarier. The Reclamation order is there to retrieve the Cerebral Casts and start the pain all over again, or retrieve Scorches against opponent who like to let them through and burn through plascretes.

The 1 Whirlpool is there because I noticed once people realize most of my ICE doesn't "bite", they will run to force me to rez. The plan is to put it in front of a Bullfrog and force an unexpecting opponent into an archer or an edge of world.

For econ I went for Melanges instead of Celeb Gift, since they work fairly well in a never advance server, and I found that Celeb Gifts tend to give away too much info from my HQ, especially waiting scorches of agenda floods.

name: Silhouette - No Secrets
description:
V 1.2 Account Siphon + Dirty Laundry + Sure gamble drive the deck economy. Layer Up to purge Tags (since we do not want Woman in Red trashed) Also cycles some cards in the deck along with Quality Time.

Woman in the Red Dress lets us take a peek at what the corporation is drawing. The cards that we do not see with Woman in Red we can peek at with Bug. (We should always know what is in the Corporations hand.)

We can then use leg work + HQ interface to basically access the Corporations entire HQ.

Sneakdoor Beta puts pressure on the Corporation to ICE up archives because they know we are coming for HQ.

Levy lets us recycle where needed.

Account Siphon + Silhouette + Blackguard should help keep the Corporation poor(er) since we are dictating when they spend their money or just taking it from them and giving it to us!

With so much exposing (and on corporation draws) it will make the corporation feel like they are playing a face up beginners game.

As always more testing and tweeking required.

name: Run ken v1
Cloaked Chaos
description:
Updated list, always changing and trying to tune the deck. Removed a lot of cards and trying to shift the deck back towards a solid breaker suite that can answer any threat cheaply. Dagger is still the all-star here, even without PB. ZU is free with Toolbox out and Corroder/GBlade is just value. e3 tears through Bioroids and the singleton silencer takes the pressure off of my cloaks and allows me some wiggle room in my MU. Lib Accounts and MO provide great econ and FCC allows me to burst for 8-10 on a regular basis.

All in all, I enjoy the deck. It's fairly cheap to run, past the expensive set-up and it's difficult for the Corp to keep this deck out of any server.

name: Andromeda on the cheap
description:
Capitalize on your huge opening hand to get cash and an early run (or both with Account Siphon). Get Desperado out early (hopefully on the cheap with Modded), call their bluff by revealing ICE, and throw down a Forged Activation Orders if it's too pricey to rez. Tutor for your cheap breakers: once they're out, Legwork and Maker's Eye are great for pounding central servers. Everything's so cheap you should have tons of cash for your breakers!

Thoughts welcome.

name: Random Noisy Chaos
description: A classic Noise mill: get those viruses out ASAP, recycle them with Deja Vu & Scavenge, force the Corp to trash what might be the integral card in their combo. The sheer volume of viruses will force them to lose half their R&D and risk being milled... if you don't surge a Darwin and run their archives first.

name: Guard's Up
description:
With enough ICE in the deck to guarantee 2 or 3 in your opening hand, drop the cheap stuff and hold on to the scary Bioroid ICE for later. (A ZED + Eli/Ichi combo can be devastating early-game.)

Late-game, drop & advance agendas in one remote and use the threat of huge ICE from Awakening Centre and Howler to scare the runner off... at least for that turn. But you only need one turn to score the agenda!

Possibly sub in an Inazuma for the Chum? ICE at your discretion! Thoughts welcome.

name: Tennin Block
description:
A pretty standard build for Tennin. Drop Shock! into Archives, set up your cheap end-the-run ICE early in front of R&D, leave HQ undefended to threaten a Snare! or Shi.Kyu, and then set up a couple of remote servers. RSVP in front of assets works very well, as does the really scary ICE in front of your "agenda" server. Mushin + GRNDL or Junebug will keep the runner guessing. Every turn they don't run or get tripped up gives you free advancement tokens to Trick of Light onto your agendas.

Thoughts welcome.

name: iMac
description:
This is my Overmind Kate deck. I don't know if it's good, but it is currently 3 for 5:

-Loss against Jinteki RP remote server spam

-Loss against HB NEXT

-Win against Weyland GRNDL

-Win against HB core

-Win against Weyland core

The idea is to amass 10+ MU for your Overminds, then break every ICE you meet with recurring creds from Spinal Modem and Cyberfeeder. Quickly build rig (specifically hardware) with Replicator and Inside Man. Underworld Contact is good drip econ with Dyson. Trash useless Overminds with Aesop's, then recur with Scavenge and Test Run. I think Clone Chip/LLDS can be cut, although LLDS did cause me to win against the HB core deck.

Mimic is for Swordsman. Considering add an Inti for Wraparound also.

name: Jinteki Halfshell
description:
A not-terribly-polished attempt to justify putting Sundew in a deck. Uses Neural Katana, Uroboros, and Hourglass to punish initial central server runs, with Wall of Thorns and Enigma to provide a secondary line of defense for important central servers. Grim is mostly to take a little bit of the pressure off of the ETR ice. Junebug and Snare! are there to provide cover for 3/2 agendas, and secondarily for overadvancing Braintrust.

Possible next steps include putting Diversified Portfolio, refining the ice suite, etc.

name: Double Decker Chaos Theory
description:
Chock full of double events to generate huge income. On top of that, many ways to plow through your deck and get your big breakers cheated into play (Test Run+Scavenge/Eureka, Personal Workshop+Stimhack). Once your rig is up (Dinosaurus, Garrote, Torch, Morningstar, and Paintbrush), use Levy AR Lab Access to recycle your economy. Cool trick with Eureka. If you find it to be useless later on, overdraw to discard it (which is easy with all the draw in the deck), and then play Power Nap to get a bigger boost.

This is a very experimental deck but seems fun to play. It does lack obvious protection from scorch and the like and may have trouble with consistency. Any and all suggestions welcome.

name: Razor Flavored Gum
description: Chew the Chew

name: Professor Hoarder
description: Time to Test!

name: Replicating Taxation
description: Replicating Perfection with Asset economy, annoying ICE and Agendas, and Caprice Nisei. Simple.
